intro: Heracleum benearnense, commonly known as the Benearn giant hogweed, is a tall herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its large, umbrella-shaped white flowers and deeply lobed leaves. It can grow up to 3 meters in height, making it one of the tallest members of its family. Its sap contains phototoxic compounds, which can cause severe skin irritation when exposed to sunlight.
